blogroll.name: Katy DeCorah
blogroll.note: Blogs about web development and life. Katy has provided lots of inspiration for how I build parts of Flamed Fury.

blogroll.name: Cory Dransfeldt
blogroll.note: Whenever I want to do something on my website, I check to see if Cory has already done it.

blogroll.name: Robb Knight
blogroll.note: If Cory hasn't done what I'm looking to do, then Robb is my next stop.

blogroll.name: Xandra
blogroll.note: Xandra, my Small Web bestie is finally blogging, about the web! Watch this one.

blogroll.name: yequari
blogroll.note: Helps out over at the 32-bit Cafe and occasionally blogs about web things.

blogroll.name: lostletters
blogroll.note: A friend from the 32-bit Cafe. Another 2000s web throwback. Blogs about mental health, life, veganism and web development.

blogroll.name: Frills
blogroll.note: Frills' has crafted a beautiful website for herself with 11ty and Neocities. Filled with experiments, blogs, developer resources. The HTML named colours experiment is awesome.

blogroll.name: Chris Burnell
blogroll.note: Chris has become a great friend and has been great to bounce ideas with. His website is huge and has heaps to explore. Development, IndieWeb, beer...

blogroll.name: Joel Chrono
blogroll.note: Joel is another recent friend who I've been chatting with. Great website to dive into emulation and blogging in general.

blogroll.name: anhvn
blogroll.note: I love anhvn's redesigns. Has a great resources list. Blogs from time to time and I love when they sprinkle the comic panels throughout website updates.

blogroll.name: Minutes to Midnight
blogroll.note: Simone is a musician and blogger. He thinks and blogs about similar things to me.

blogroll.name: The Cheapskates Guide to Computers and the Internet
blogroll.note: Essays about the otherside of the Internet with a focus on low cost computing.

blogroll.name: Manuel Moreale
blogroll.note: Blogs about tech, the web and disconnecting.

blogroll.name: Sara Joy
blogroll.note: Sara is a web developer and mother. Maintains the CSS Joy webring. Enjoy our banter on Mastodon.

blogroll.name: disassociated
blogroll.note: disassociated is blogging about similar things to fLaMEd FURY. Posts about the web and other interests. Some absolute banger web commentary.

blogroll.name: Notes by JCProbably
blogroll.note: Jedda posts about the web, blogging, photography, books and other stuff. I absolutely love her Postroll, a great source of new posts to read!

blogroll.name: suboptimalism
blogroll.note: Suboptimalism is a personal philosophy developed during a four-month period of intense reflection in a library.

blogroll.name: Living Out Loud
blogroll.note: Living Out Loud is a personal blog by internet good guy, Lou Plummer. Lou shares personal stories from across his life. There's a great new story to read every day.

coolSites.name: alexandra
coolSites.note: Xandra runs the 32-bit Cafe. Her museum is a lovingly handcrafted homepage that calls back to a 2000s web. Sometimes writes essays.

coolSites.name: Let's Learn Together!
coolSites.note: A collection of handcrafted essays and learning material covering a broad range of topics

coolSites.name: Coby Cat's Abode
coolSites.note: A fantastic handmade site. Covers European/Belgian Disney stuff.

coolSites.name: DVD Nerd
coolSites.note: Check out the DVD Push Button reviews.

coolSites.name: Trans Rats
coolSites.note: Don't try this on your mobile, but check out the crazy Pokemon plushie collection!

coolSites.name: It's Not Stupid
coolSites.note: An Invader Zim fan site. This is everything that a fan site should be!

coolSites.name: Ray's Miscellany
coolSites.note: Brisray has been developing and maintaining his website since 1999. Lots of pages to get lost in and boasts the most complete collection and overview of webrings.

coolSites.name: 10@earth ~
coolSites.note: A statically generated shrine to 10's life and interests. The site map is a beautiful way to explore the website.

coolSites.name: Bytemoth's Brook
coolSites.note: Bytemoth is a Digital Warlock and has been around a while. Start at the homepage and dive in and get lost.

coolSites.name: Cinni's Dream Home
coolSites.note: Literally an online art project. Check out Cinni's shrines, art and games!

webDevelopment.name: 32-Bit Cafe
webDevelopment.note: A web space community that I help moderate. The 32-bit Cafe focuses on building websites for self-expression and creativity, made up of professionals, hobbyists, and enthusiasts of the personal web. Our goal is to help non web developers create their own websites.

webDevelopment.name: MDN Web Docs
webDevelopment.note: A complete set of articles aims to guide complete beginners to web development with all that they need to start coding websites.

webDevelopment.name: Smashing Magazine
webDevelopment.note: Magazine on CSS, JavaScript, front-end, accessibility, UX and design. For developers, designers and front-end engineers.

webDevelopment.name: CodePen
webDevelopment.note: An online code editor, learning environment, and community for front-end web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript code snippets, projects, and web applications.

webDevelopment.name: Every Layout
webDevelopment.note: Through a series of simple, composable layouts, Every Layout will teach you how to better harness the built-in algorithms that power browsers and CSS.

webDevelopment.name: Utopia
webDevelopment.note: Fluid responsive design for your websites.

webDevelopment.name: 11ty
webDevelopment.note: Eleventy, a simpler static site generator.

webDevelopment.name: 11tybundle
webDevelopment.note: Weekly posts full of 11ty resources from across the web.

webDevelopment.name: 11ty Rocks!
webDevelopment.note: A collection of Eleventy (11ty) starters, projects, plugins, and resources by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: SmolCSS
webDevelopment.note: Minimal snippets for modern CSS layouts and components by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: Modern CSS
webDevelopment.note: A series examining modern CSS solutions to problems by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: HTML Recipes
webDevelopment.note: A collection of quick copy HTML snippets for a variety of common scenarios by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: Kevin Powell
webDevelopment.note: Helping you learn how to make the web, and make it look good while you're at it.

newsLetters.name: The History Of the Web
newsLetters.note: The best stories from the web's history.

newsLetters.name: Kevin Powell's Newsletter
newsLetters.note: Updates, little tips & tricks, and awesome resources from Kevin Powell.

newsLetters.name: People and Blogs
newsLetters.note: People and Blogs is a weekly newsletter by Manuel Moreale, where he asks interesting people to talk about themselves and their blogs.

newsLetters.name: Webworm with David Farrier
newsLetters.note: David Farrier's stories from the weird side of the Internet.

podCasts.name: The Real Pod presents: Remember When
podCasts.note: ENDED. Aotearoa Specific. Revisit New Zealand's pop culture past with Jane Yee, Duncan Greive and Alex Casey.

podCasts.name: Rebel FM
podCasts.note: My gaming fix. They play games and talk about them, their lives, and how the two intersect. Usually. And there are jokes..

podCasts.name: Darknet Diaries
podCasts.note: Stories from the dark side of the Internet. A podcast about hackers, breaches, shadow government activity, hacktivism, cybercrime, and all the things that dwell on the hidden parts of the network. This is Darknet Diaries.

podCasts.name: Shop Talk Show
podCasts.note: A weekly podcast about building websites from Dave Rupert and Chris Coyier.

podCasts.name: Hemespheric Views
podCasts.note: Hemespheric Views is a podcast about technology, media, food, cultural differences and family life.

podCasts.name: Ruminate
podCasts.note: A podcast about the web, games, and terrible food.

searchEngines.name: Kagi
searchEngines.note: Kagi is a paid search product. It is also a fast, private search engine that provides results that have your best interests in mind. I'm paying for it and using it as my default search.

searchEngines.name: Marginalia Search
searchEngines.note: An independent search engine that favours text-heavy websites. Focuses on non-commercial content, and attempts to show you sites you perhaps weren't aware of in favor of the sort of sites you probably already knew existed.

searchEngines.name: searchmysite
searchEngines.note: The searchmysite.net search engine is a niche search, focussing on the "indieweb" or "small web" or "digital gardens", i.e. non-commercial content, primarily personal and independent websites.

searchEngines.name: Wiby
searchEngines.note: Wiby is a search engine for older style pages, lightweight and based on a subject of interest. Building a web more reminiscent of the early internet.

searchEngines.name: Gibiru
searchEngines.note: Uncensored private search engine. They exist to provide access to information outside of big tech's censorship bubble and do so privately.

searchEngines.name: Infotiger
searchEngines.note: Independent, privacy respecting search engine. Building their own index, sitting at around 300 million english websites indexed.

searchEngines.name: Yep
searchEngines.note: New search engine built from scratch. Claims to offer an unbiased, private search experience that rewards and compensates the makers behind the content...

searchEngines.name: Stract
searchEngines.note: Independent and open search. You can apply different optics to narrow down the types of page you're looking for.

searchEngines.name: Mwmbl
searchEngines.note: Mwmbl is a free search engine with a focus on freedom, user experience, and community. Results are provided by their own index and a touch of curation.

searchEngines.name: Plumb
searchEngines.note: Plumb is a new search engine that claims it doesn't monitor or track you while you search. Supported by ads, but is not an ad platform that supports search.

searchEngines.name: Clew
searchEngines.note: A super new search engine that is trying to be different than the rest. Starting off with a super small index with plans to grow.

searchEngines.name: Mojeek
searchEngines.note: Mojeek is a growing independent search engine which does not track you. Mojeek have their own crawler and are building their own index.

searchEngines.name: Raw Web
searchEngines.note: Explore the gems of independent websites. A search engine built from independant website feeds.

webDirectories.name: ooh.directory
webDirectories.note: A collection of 2084+ blogs about every topic.

webDirectories.name: Ye Olde Blogroll
webDirectories.note: A humanly curated list of fine personal & independent blogs that are updated regularly. No algorithms ever!

webDirectories.name: personalsit.es
webDirectories.note: A site to share and revel in personal websites.

webDirectories.name: i.webthings directory
webDirectories.note: A hand curated directory of websites to explore with a focus on the independent and noncommercial web.

webDirectories.name: Kagi Small Web
webDirectories.note: A Stumble Upon like web surfing experience.

webDirectories.name: Bukmark.Club
webDirectories.note: A brand new independent web directory.

webDirectories.name: The Forest
webDirectories.note: The Forest, by Manu and Carl aims to bring back some unpredictability to surfing the web.

webDirectories.name: A Blog Directory
webDirectories.note: A home for everyone's Blog and Post rolls.

webDirectories.name: MelonLand Surf Club
webDirectories.note: The surf club is a webring that is designed to promote and help people find the homepages of MelonLand Forum members! .

webDirectories.name: The Big List of Personal Websites
webDirectories.note: Terraaeon is maintaing a big list of personal websites. Submission form at the bottom.

linkBlogs.name: fLaMEd's Bookmarks
linkBlogs.note: Yup, my own bookmarks page. Focuses on interesting posts from across the small and open web.

linkBlogs.name: Linkage
linkBlogs.note: An old fashioned link blog by Lou Plummer. Updated daily.

linkBlogs.name: Link Punk
linkBlogs.note: A link blog by Brad Enslen, shares articles and posts they find interesting.

linkBlogs.name: i.webthings.hub
linkBlogs.note: A long running link blog by Joe Jenett

linkBlogs.name: Chris Burnell's Bookmarks
linkBlogs.note: Chris's collection of bookmarks from across the web.

linkBlogs.name: Cory's Links
linkBlogs.note: Cory is collecting and sharing links that he finds interesting focusing on tech and development.

linkBlogs.name: Robb's Links
linkBlogs.note: Robb is collecting and sharing links from across the web focusing on the internet, tech and development.

linkBlogs.name: JCProbably's Postroll
linkBlogs.note: Jedda is currating a rolling list of posts, blogs, and links that she's been enjoying. Small web and blogging focused.

linkBlogs.name: Chris McCleod's Bookmarks
linkBlogs.note: Chris is collecting and sharing links focusing on the internet, tech, and development.

linkBlogs.name: Distinctive Quality Links
linkBlogs.note: Ovi is collecting links on designing, coding, and writing for the web and email.

linkBlogs.name: Juha-Matti's Weeklies
linkBlogs.note: Juha shares interesting links to articles, talks etc that they come across weekly.

linkBlogs.name: Lou Plummer's Cool Links
linkBlogs.note: Lou is collecting and sharing cool links from across the web.

linkBlogs.name: Bounty of bookmarks
linkBlogs.note: Rather than hoarding and keeping bookmarks to themselves, Felix is sharing with the bounty of bookmarks. Thousands of bookamrks devided into categories for browsing.

linkBlogs.name: Hidde's Links
linkBlogs.note: Hiddie is collecting posts about the web and tech.

linkBlogs.name: The internet used to be fun
linkBlogs.note: A collection of posts across the web about, well the web!

linkBlogs.name: Tangible Life Linkposts
linkBlogs.note: Steve is collecting and sharing links from across the web as a link log as a subset of his blog.

multiMedia.name: The Movie Database (TMDB)
multiMedia.note: The Movie Database (TMDB) is a community built movie and television database. This website has superseded the usefulness of the IMDB for me. allows users to sign up, contribute data and track what they've watched.

multiMedia.name: The TV Database (TVDB
multiMedia.note: Another community driven television and movie database. Great alternative for the movie database. Full of great user curated lists of various movies and television shows.

multiMedia.name: The Internet Music Video Database (IMVDb)
multiMedia.note: The Internet Music Video Database is another community driven database but for music videos. They track credits, technical information, and other data about music videos.

multiMedia.name: Internet Game Database (IGDB)
multiMedia.note: Discover, Rate and track your games. The Internet Game Database is another community contributed Database for video games.
